configs.description:
Settings for terrain sampling and analysis of those samples.
Foundation of the watershed model.

properties.name: TerrainSamplesPerChunk
properties.description: Number of sample points used to analyze terrain slope in each chunk. Higher values give more accurate terrain analysis but impact performance. Second most important config for performance after the max stream length.

properties.name: SmallChunkRoughnessThreshold
properties.description:
RMSE in blocks (Root Mean Squared Error) for small-scale streams (32x32 chunks).
RMSE measures how much terrain deviates from a smooth plane.
Steep but consistent slopes have low RMSE, bumpy terrain with many ups and downs have high RMSE.
Increase this to allow small scale streams on bumpier terrain.

properties.name: LargeChunkRoughnessThreshold
properties.description:
RMSE in blocks (Root Mean Squared Error) for large-scale streams (64x64 chunks).
RMSE measures how much terrain deviates from a smooth plane.
Steep but consistent slopes have low RMSE, bumpy terrain with many ups and downs have high RMSE.
Large streams are lower resolution so they need smoother terrain than small streams.
Increase this to allow large scale streams on bumpier terrain.

configs.description:
Settings for the waterflow part of the watershed model.
Gets the waterflow paths ready for potential streams and groundwater.

properties.name: PressureTowardsDrainRadiusInChunks
properties.description:
Distance (in chunks) that a chunk will check for nearby drain points.
Affects how far terrain slope vectors search for nearby drain/water chunks to shift their slope vector angle towards.
Higher values create a stronger pull towards drains for the flow pathing.
This enables more streams to generate but lowers the impact of terrain slopes, lowering the quality of flow (and therefore stream) pathing near the water.

properties.name: PeakAnglePressureTowardsDrain
properties.description: Maximum vector angle degrees that drain points can shift terrain slope vectors by.

properties.name: DrainChunkDetectionSensitivity
properties.description:
How many blocks a chunk's average sample height can be below sea level (or above if negative) to consider the chunk a possible drain for a stream.
Higher values mean less drain chunks, so streams only start in deeper water, but streams will start further into a basin which can look terrible.
Lower or negative values mean more drain chunks, so streams will start closer to shore, but rivers could also drain to shallows or even into flat ground, which also looks terrible.
If you adjust this, make sure you also adjust the stream mouth fade configs to match.

properties.name: DrainAreaRadius
properties.description:
For a drainchunk on a lake/ocean's bank/coast to create a stream pathing out of it (and draining into it), it needs a minimum amount of chunks around it to be drains as well.
The DrainAreaRadius is the radius of chunks around that drainchunk that are checked for this minimum amount.
Adjust this alongside NumberOfDrainChunksWithinDrainAreaForStream.
Increase if you don't want streams draining to small lakes, decrease it if you want streams with smaller lakes.

properties.name: NumberOfDrainChunksWithinDrainAreaForStream
properties.description:
For a drainchunk on a lake/ocean's bank/coast to create a stream pathing out of it (and draining into it), it needs a minimum amount of chunks around it to be drains as well.
The NumberOfDrainChunksWithinDrainAreaForStream is the number of drainchunks needed to be within a radius of a stream's drainchunk for it to be considered for a potential stream.
Adjust this alongside DrainAreaRadius.
If this is too low you could get unnatural streams draining to spotty/marshy/shallow areas or tiny lakes.

properties.name: FlowStageIterationsPerChunk
properties.description:
Controls how many iterations the water flow simulation performs per chunk.
Higher values create water flow where rainfall on slopes travel further in the watershed model, but it exponentially increases generation time.
Basically determines how far away you want flow to go.
If you change this and you use groundwater, you'll have to adjust up the minimum flow needed for groundwater (check the actual flow values, don't do it blind).

properties.name: MinimumSlopeMagnitudeForDirectionalInflow
properties.description:
Minimum slope magnitude threshold for inflow to consider the slope vector's direction.
Chunk slope vectors under this value are treated as flat and streams pathing through it can move to any adjacent direction.
Too low means that less streams form on flat areas, too high means that streams ignore terrain and more often path over terrain that slopes the wrong way.

configs.description: General settings for various parts of stream generation.

properties.name: MaxStreamLength
properties.description:
The primary setting for performance.
Maximum possible length for a stream in small (32x32) and large (64x64) chunks.
A 10 chunk long stream would be 640 blocks long if it is a large scale stream, and 320 blocks long if it is small scale.
The size of the watershed model that generates around you increases exponentially with the max stream length.
A max length below 10 will have world generation speed at almost the same speed as basegame.
A max length above 20 will leave you waiting for chunks to generate.
This also has diminishing returns on what you get, as terrain that can support long rivers is rare unless you scale up the terrain in the basegame's world settings.
Large scale streams with a max stream length of 15 chunks will cover almost all stream-suitable slope paths you'll find. At that length on a good CPU & render distance you could continually travel without catching up to generating chunks.
If you want a max length above 15 make sure you have a good CPU or you're playing on a dedicated server.
Gets pretty crazy above stream length 21, later i'll make a preset for very long streams.

properties.name: MinStreamLength
properties.description: Minimum stream length in small (32x32) and large (64x64) chunks. Streams shorter than this are discarded.

properties.name: StreamScalingAnchorLength
properties.description:
Reference stream length (in chunks) at which width/depth values are applied.
Streams scale proportionally relative to this.
For instance, if you set the StreamBedWidthAtAnchor config to 60, the stream bed will be 60 blocks wide on the 26th chunk downstream from the stream's source.
And if the MinimumBedWidth is 30, the stream bed will be 45 blocks wide on the 13th chunk downstream (halfway to the anchor) from the source.

properties.name: StreamTerrainInfluenceRadius
properties.description:
Distance (in chunks) that streams affect surrounding terrain.
Must be large enough to cover the stream's full valley width, so increase this if you increase the width of streams a large amount.

properties.name: Tributary
properties.description: Configuration for tributary generation including minimum length, merge behavior, and pathing options.

nestedProperties.name: MinimumLength
nestedProperties.description: Minimum tributary length in small (32x32) and large (64x64) chunks. Tributaries shorter than this are discarded.

nestedProperties.name: MergeDownstreamOffset
nestedProperties.description:
How far tributaries curve downstream the main stream when joining the main stream.
The unit for this is curve points, the spacing between them on a stream path is defined by "Curve Point Spacing" in Stream Mapping.

nestedProperties.name: MainStreamProximityThreshold
nestedProperties.description: Distance threshold (multiplier on tributary width at each curve point) from the main stream for deciding when to truncate tributaries that get too close to the main stream, and reconnecting them at the conflict/intersection.

nestedProperties.name: EnableLookahead
nestedProperties.description: Whether tributaries use lookahead pathing over greedy pathing.

properties.name: BendPool
properties.description: Configuration for bend pool effect where curved sections of streams are carved deeper, creating pools.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description: Enable bend pool effect. Curved sections of streams are carved deeper, creating pools.

nestedProperties.name: MaxDepthBoost
nestedProperties.description:
Maximum extra block depth that gets carved in curved stream sections.
Straight sections get no extra depth. The boost is scaled by the magnitude of the stream's curvature in each area.
3.0 means the most curved sections can be up to 3 blocks deeper than normal.

nestedProperties.name: CurvatureThreshold
nestedProperties.description:
Curvature magnitude threshold for determining if a section of a stream is curving.
This is used to create pools in curved areas.
Values above this threshold are considered curved, below are straight.
Lower values make more areas of the stream count as curved, which makes bigger and longer pools at the stream's curves.

nestedProperties.name: SmoothingWindow
nestedProperties.description:
Number of curve points to average out when smoothing curvature for the bend pools.
Also softens out outlier/tiny bumps so you don't get pools in straight areas.

nestedProperties.name: LookAroundDistance
nestedProperties.description:
Number of curve points to look ahead/behind when calculating curvature.
A higher LookAroundDistance detects bigger curves, and lower detects tighter local bends.

configs.description: Settings for how streams path through the watershed model's waterflow.

properties.name: PathingAwayFromDrainScalar
properties.description: The multiplier on the preference that streams have for pathing away from their drains.

properties.name: PathingLookaheadDepth
properties.description:
Number of chunks to look ahead when pathing streams. 0 means greedy pathing.
Search up lookahead pathing algorithm to find out what this is.

properties.name: PathingLookaheadBeamWidth
properties.description: Maximum possible potential paths to explore at each lookahead depth.

properties.name: StreamConflictChainDepth
properties.description:
Maximum depth for resolving chains of conflicting streams.
This chain is when a stream gets overridden by a stronger stream that gets overridden by a stronger stream and so on.
Doesn't really happen much at low world heights and rough terrain.
Breaks determinism in the worst case, but its so rare that its better to just prevent the performance hit.
If you want full determinism just set this to 9999.

configs.description: Settings for how the streams are drawn on the stream maps.

properties.name: MaxHeightRangeForNoiseFadeOut
properties.description:
The terrain height range (in blocks) at which stream shape noise completely fades out.
Lower means smoother more bezier-like streams in rough terrain.
Only applies to straight streams, meandering and braided streams don't use shape noise.

properties.name: ConnectionPointNoiseFadeDistanceInBezierPoints
properties.description:
Distance (in curve points) from connection points where noise fades from 0 to normal.
Connection points are the drain for main streams, and the main stream connection for tributaries.
Connection points have 0 noise to prevent the stream from being misaligned with the connection.

properties.name: SmallStreamMapBlockColumnsPerPixel
properties.description:
Number of block columns represented by a single pixel in small-scale stream maps.
A higher value means a lower resolution with better performance but less detail.
4 = one pixel represents a 4x4 block area,
1 = one pixel per block column.
Put it at 1 or 2. 1 means the stream maps take a long time to generate. 2 means the stream maps generate fast, but they're a little more rough.

properties.name: LargeStreamMapBlockColumnsPerPixel
properties.description:
Number of block columns represented by a single pixel in large-scale stream maps.
A higher value means a lower resolution with better performance but less detail.
4 = one pixel represents a 4x4 block area,
1 = one pixel per block column.
Put it at 1 or 2. 1 means the stream maps take a long time to generate. 2 means the stream maps generate fast, but they're a little more rough.

properties.name: CurvePointSpacing
properties.description:
Spacing between curve points along the stream path in blocks.
Basically defines the resolution of the line the streams follow (the stream path).
It used to be fully accurate to blocks when stream maps were 1 pixel to 1 block, but 1:1 ratio is now affected by large scale rivers and the stream map resolution (BlockColumnsPerPixel).
Lower means more points and a higher resolution. Higher means fewer points and a lower resolution.
Test any changes you make to this against the stream maps, don't change it blind.

properties.name: StreamShapeNoise
properties.description:
Defines noise parameters for natural wobbling of the stream shape on the stream maps.
This only gets applied to straight rivers. Meandering and braided rivers use an iterative meandering technique to change their shape.
If you edit this enough you can get cheap meandering, but the best results come from more expensive iterative methods.
You can get good small/minor meander-like curves using this as well.

nestedProperties.name: NoiseScale
nestedProperties.description:
Controls the overall size of map noise based stream wobbling.
Basically increases the distance between each consecutive stream bend (peak/trough).

nestedProperties.name: NoiseOctaves
nestedProperties.description:
Determines the complexity of the stream curve noise.
Look up perlin noise octaves to learn about this.

nestedProperties.name: NoisePersistence
nestedProperties.description:
Controls how quickly map noise detail diminishes across octaves.
For instance: with a noise persistence of 0.2 and a noise value of 1 on the first octave, means the second octave has a noise value of 0.8.
Makes stream direction changes more chaotic.

nestedProperties.name: NoiseLacunarity
nestedProperties.description: Controls the increase of frequency between the noise octaves. Makes streams more bumpy

nestedProperties.name: NoiseDisplacement
nestedProperties.description: Controls the amplitude of the noise. Makes stream bends longer, stretching further away from a straight stream path.

nestedProperties.name: HeightRangeScalarPower
nestedProperties.description:
Power curve applied to the height range scalar when calculating stream map noise intensity.
1.0 is linear, over 1.0 gives an aggressive fade in rough terrain, and under 1.0 gives a gentle fade.

nestedProperties.name: StreamLengthScalarPower
nestedProperties.description:
Power curve applied to the stream length scalar when calculating stream map noise intensity.
1.0 gives linear scaling with the stream length, over 1.0 gives longer streams exponentially more noise.

properties.name: DrainFade
properties.description: Configuration for fading out the stream as it approaches a drain.

nestedProperties.name: DrainFadeOffset
nestedProperties.description:
How far away the fade circle is from the stream mouth.
Uses a gradient circle to fade out the stream mouth into the drain.
Basically a simple fadeout of the stream as it gets to the water.

nestedProperties.name: DrainFadeRadius
nestedProperties.description:
How big the fade circle is.
Uses a gradient circle to fade out the stream mouth into the drain.
Basically a simple fadeout of the stream as it gets to the water.

configs.description: Noise and carving settings that define how a stream map is applied to the terrain.

properties.name: StreamTerrainInfluenceAtAnchor
properties.description:
Stream's terrain influence strength at the scaling anchor length.
Most stream properties fade in with terrain influence, so you can almost treat it as the stream opacity for most features.

properties.name: StreamTerrainInfluenceAtSource
properties.description:
Stream's terrain influence strength at the source.
Most stream properties fade in with terrain influence, so you can almost treat it as the stream opacity for most features.

properties.name: StreamWidthInterpolationPower
properties.description:
Power curve for interpolating noise related features from source to mouth.
Currently applies to height variation and canyon wall rockiness, may be used for more later.

properties.name: MoundSuppression
properties.description: Configuration for suppressing terrain mounds/hills within stream areas.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description:
Enables suppression of terrain mounds/hills within stream areas.
This is an asymmetrical noise reduction specifically set up to target small mounds that get in the way of rivers.
The terrain sampling on the watershed model helps to avoid most rough terrain and bumps, but rarely some get through so this is used to carve through them.
It carves canyons into the terrain a little bit, but its worth it to prevent streams from being split apart by a mound.

nestedProperties.name: Strength
nestedProperties.description: Strength of mound suppression in stream areas.

properties.name: LandformCarving
properties.description: Configuration for carving down landform hills/mounds in stream areas.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description:
Enables carving of landform features (hills/mounds) in stream areas.
This is the older landform component of the mound suppression.
While the more general asymmetric noise suppression does a better job of carving down mounds, it seems landform noise still gets in the way a little bit.
Haven't touched this much since I got the asymmetric noise suppression working, it needs another look at some point.

nestedProperties.name: Strength
nestedProperties.description: Strength of landform carving in stream areas.

nestedProperties.name: Power
nestedProperties.description: Power curve for landform carving scaling.

nestedProperties.name: UseExponential
nestedProperties.description: Use exponential scaling for landform carving instead of linear.

properties.name: StreambankHeightVariation
properties.description: Configuration for natural height variation along streambanks via adding extra noise.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description: Enables natural height variation along streambanks via adding extra noise.

nestedProperties.name: FactorsAtSource
nestedProperties.description: Per-octave streambank height variation factors at stream sources.

nestedProperties.name: FactorsAtMouth
nestedProperties.description: Per-octave streambank height variation factors at stream mouths.

nestedProperties.name: MaxVariation
nestedProperties.description: Maximum streambank height variation for each octave.

properties.name: CanyonRockiness
properties.description: Configuration for rocky/cliffy variation on canyon walls via adding extra noise.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description: Enables rocky/cliffy variation on canyon walls via adding extra noise.

nestedProperties.name: FactorsAtSource
nestedProperties.description: Per-octave canyon wall rockiness factors at stream sources.

nestedProperties.name: FactorsAtMouth
nestedProperties.description: Per-octave canyon wall rockiness factors at stream mouths.

nestedProperties.name: MaxRockiness
nestedProperties.description: Maximum canyon wall rockiness for each octave.

properties.name: StreambedSmoothing
properties.description:
Configuration for smoothing streambed height transitions.
Creates a smooth streambed.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description: Enables smoothing of streambed height transitions.

nestedProperties.name: LookaheadDistance
nestedProperties.description: Distance (in curve points) to look ahead when smoothing streambed heights.

nestedProperties.name: SlopeDepthScaling
nestedProperties.description:
Multiplier that scales how much terrain slope affects streambed depth.
Higher values carve deeper streambeds where the terrain drops.

properties.name: SeaLevelFade
properties.description:
Configuration for fading out stream displacement (terrain carving/erosion) near sea level.
This helps to prevent deep stream carving near shallow drains.
Its alright at the current settings, but if you make it more aggressive and shallow it starts looking pretty rough.

nestedProperties.name: SeaLevelFadeStartOffset
nestedProperties.description:
Blocks below sea level where stream displacement fade begins.
Fades out the displacement (stream terrain carving/erosion) as it gets closer to the stream mouth.

nestedProperties.name: SeaLevelFadeEndOffset
nestedProperties.description:
Blocks below sea level where stream displacement fade ends.
Fades out the displacement (stream terrain carving/erosion) as it gets closer to the stream mouth.

configs.description: Settings for how meandering streams are warped into meanders on the streammap.

properties.name: EnabledChance
properties.description: Percent chance for a stream to be a meandering stream.

properties.name: MeanderIterations
properties.description:
Number of iterative passes for the progressive meandering.
Each iteration applies small displacements that accumulate over the iterations into larger meanders.
Not enough iterations and the streams will be basic, more closely resembling their base bezier curves.
After a certain point the iterations becomes meaningless. You can meander the streams forever.

properties.name: SinuosityAtSource
properties.description:
Sinuosity at the stream source.
Sinuosity scales the amplitude of the meandering sine-based curves per iteration.
The sinuosity lerps from the source to the anchor based on the distance along the stream.
Super volatile value, completely changes how meandering works with even a tiny change.

properties.name: SinuosityAtAnchor
properties.description:
Sinuosity at the anchor point.
Streams longer than anchor length continue extrapolating linearly.
1.0 means a straight line. 1.5+ gives massive meandering.
The sinuosity lerps from the source to the anchor based on the distance along the stream.
Super volatile value, completely changes how meandering works with even a tiny change.

properties.name: SinuosityScalingPower
properties.description: Power curve applied to to the sinuosity as it goes from source to anchor.

properties.name: WavelengthMultiplierAtSource
properties.description:
Wavelength multiplier at the stream source (thin end).
The meander wavelength (meander length down the stream) at each point is the streambed width at that point multiplied by this value.
Higher wavelength multiplier means longer, more gradual meanders.
Lower wavelength multiplier means tighter, more frequent bends.
You can use UseConstantBeltWidthRatio (on by default) instead of this for simpler but less fine tuned meander wavelengths.

properties.name: WavelengthMultiplierAtAnchor
properties.description:
Wavelength multiplier at the anchor point.
Streams longer than anchor length continue growing the meander wavelength linearly.
The meander wavelength (meander length down the stream) at each point is the streambed width at that point multiplied by this value.
Higher wavelength multiplier means longer, more gradual meanders.
Lower wavelength multiplier means tighter, more frequent bends.
You can use UseConstantBeltWidthRatio (on by default) instead of this for simpler but less fine tuned meander wavelengths.

properties.name: WavelengthScalingPower
properties.description: Power curve applied to the wavelength scaling from source to anchor.

properties.name: UseConstantBeltWidthRatio
properties.description:
When true, automatically calculates wavelength multipliers to maintain a constant meander belt width to stream width ratio along all positions in the river.
The ratio is set by BeltWidthToStreamWidthRatio.
When false, the meandering uses the manually set WavelengthMultiplierAtSource and WavelengthMultiplierAtAnchor values instead.

properties.name: BeltWidthToStreamWidthRatio
properties.description:
Target ratio of meander belt width to stream bed width. Only used when UseConstantBeltWidthRatio is true.
The wavelength multipliers are automatically calculated from this ratio and the sinuosity values.

properties.name: CurvatureDisplacementMultipiler
properties.description: Higher means stronger growth of the existing bends.

properties.name: MeanderFading
properties.description: Configuration for fading out meandering into a smooth path at the stream source and mouth, as braiding at the ends of the stream gives low quality results.

nestedProperties.name: SourceDistanceAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Distance from the stream source (in blocks) when the stream is at the anchor's stream length, over which to fade meandering back to the original path.
This distance scales with stream length: short streams have proportionally shorter fade distances, long streams have proportionally longer fade distances.
Basically, its how big the fadeout of meandering is near the stream source.

nestedProperties.name: SourceExponent
nestedProperties.description:
Power curve exponent for source fade transition.
This controls how quickly the meandering fades into the straight path near the stream source.

nestedProperties.name: MouthDistanceAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Distance from the stream drain/connection (in blocks) when the stream is at the anchor's stream length, over which to fade meandering back to a straight connection.
This distance scales with stream length: short streams have proportionally shorter fade distances, long streams have proportionally longer fade distances.
Basically, its how big the fadeout of meandering is near the stream mouth.

nestedProperties.name: MouthExponent
nestedProperties.description:
Power curve exponent for mouth fade transition.
This controls how quickly the meandering fades into the straight connection to the drain/main stream.

properties.name: CurvePointSmoothing
properties.description: Configuration for smoothing out the stream path (the curve points) inbetween the iterations of meandering.

nestedProperties.name: WindowRadius
nestedProperties.description:
Number of neighboring points on each side to include in smoothing window.
Controls spatial extent of smoothing effect. Applied per iteration.
1 gives a 3-point window (current + 2 neighbors), 2 gives a 5-point window, 3 gives a 7-point window.

nestedProperties.name: Strength
nestedProperties.description:
Controls the intensity of the smoothing within the smoothing window.
0.0 to 1.0 is no smoothing to full smoothing, and 1.0+ is even more smoothing.
Adjust together with WindowRadius.

properties.name: SteepTerrainStraightening
properties.description: Configuration for straightening streams around steep terrain to prevent meandering into cliffs and hills, and to keep mountain streams clean.

nestedProperties.name: BlendStrength
nestedProperties.description:
Maximum strength of blending the meandered path back to original bezier curve path in and around steep terrain.
0 means no blending (full meandering everywhere). 1 means a hard switch to the bezier curve when the path gets to an area with the max steepness.
This prevents streams from meandering the path into nearby cliffs and hills, and keeps the stream path clean on mountains.
Use with HeightThreshold to define the relationship between terrain height and blend strength

nestedProperties.name: HeightThreshold
nestedProperties.description:
Height difference (in blocks) at which steep terrain blending reaches full strength.
The blending lerps from 0 blending at 0 height difference to the full blending strength (BlendStrength) at this configured threshold.
This prevents streams from meandering the path into nearby cliffs and hills, and keeps the stream path clean on mountains.
Use with BlendStrength to define the relationship between terrain height and blend strength

nestedProperties.name: BlendPower
nestedProperties.description: Power curve exponent for steep terrain blending. Controls how quickly blending ramps up as the nearby terrain approaches the HeightThreshold.

nestedProperties.name: SearchRadius
nestedProperties.description:
Manhattan distance radius (in chunks) for searching neighboring terrain when calculating max height difference.
0 means only use the current chunk. 1 means include immediate neighbors. 2+ means a larger search area.
A larger radius catches steep/rough terrain that is further from the stream path.

properties.name: OxbowCutoff
properties.description: Configuration for cutting off a stream as it intersects with itself via meandering, creating an oxbow lake on braided rivers.

nestedProperties.name: ProximityThreshold
nestedProperties.description:
Minimum distance between meander curves as fraction of the local meander's amplitude.
The cutoff distance scales with the stream width, so theres small meanders at the source, large at the mouth.

nestedProperties.name: MinWavelengthArcLengthFraction
nestedProperties.description:
Minimum arc length gap between segments of the stream path, as a fraction of the local wavelength.
Only segment pairs separated by at least this fraction of the wavelength are checked for oxbow cutoffs.
This prevents cutting normal stream curving, so only true oxbows (where the stream loops back on itself) are cut.
0.5 is half a wavelength, 0.75 is three-quarters. Higher values can cut the curve too early, straightening it out.

nestedProperties.name: MaxCutAttempts
nestedProperties.description: Maximum attempts to cut oxbows per iteration.

configs.description:
Settings for how braided streams are warped into meanders then overlaid with multiple meandering iterations to create point bars and a braided channel effect.
Braided streams have its own versions of the meandering configs, so that braided streams can be adjusted separately from meandering streams.

properties.name: EnabledChance
properties.description:
Percent Chance for a meandering stream to have braided streams.
Braided streams try to emulate what you see in this video: https://youtu.be/X5mgHu2bMvI

properties.name: MinSmallScaleStreamLength
properties.description:
Minimum stream length in chunks for small-scale streams to be braided instead of just meandering.
Streams shorter than this will meander but not braid.

properties.name: MinLargeScaleStreamLength
properties.description:
Minimum stream length in chunks for large-scale streams to be braided instead of just meandering.
Streams shorter than this will meander but not braid.

properties.name: HistoricalIterations
properties.description:
Number of historical meandering iterations to render before the final.
Each appears at reduced opacity, creating faded historical stream channels.
For example, with 5 historical iterations, opacities are: 17%, 33%, 50%, 67%, 83%, then 100% for the final path.

properties.name: MinOpacity
properties.description:
Opacity for the oldest historical path.
Opacity scales linearly from MaxOpacity for the first historical path to this on the final historical path.
0.25 means the oldest historical opacity is at 25%, 0.5 means the oldest is at 50%.

properties.name: MaxOpacity
properties.description:
Opacity for the historical path.
Opacity scales linearly from this for the first historical path to MinOpacity on the final historical path.
0.5 means the newest historical path's opacity is at 50%, 0.75 means the newest is at 75%.

properties.name: CaptureGap
properties.description:
Number of meandering iterations between each historical path capture.
A higher CaptureGap means more visual difference between historical paths.
With 29 iterations, 5 historical captures, and gap of 4: captures at iterations 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, final at 28.

properties.name: MeanderIterations
properties.description:
Number of iterative passes for the progressive meandering on braided streams.
Each iteration applies small displacements that accumulate over the iterations into larger meanders.
Not enough iterations and the streams will be basic, more closely resembling their base bezier curves.
After a certain point the iterations becomes meaningless. You can meander the streams forever.

properties.name: SinuosityAtSource
properties.description:
Sinuosity at the braided stream source.
Sinuosity scales the amplitude of the meandering sine-based curves per iteration.
The sinuosity lerps from the source to the anchor based on the distance along the stream.
Super volatile value, completely changes how meandering works with even a tiny change.

properties.name: SinuosityAtAnchor
properties.description:
Sinuosity at the anchor point for braided streams.
Streams longer than anchor length continue extrapolating linearly.
1.0 means a straight line. 1.5+ gives massive meandering.
The sinuosity lerps from the source to the anchor based on the distance along the stream.
Super volatile value, completely changes how meandering works with even a tiny change.

properties.name: SinuosityScalingPower
properties.description: Power curve applied to the sinuosity as it goes from source to anchor for braided streams.

properties.name: WavelengthMultiplierAtSource
properties.description:
Wavelength multiplier at the braided stream source (thin end).
The meander wavelength (meander length down the stream) at each point is the streambed width at that point multiplied by this value.
Higher wavelength multiplier means longer, more gradual meanders.
Lower wavelength multiplier means tighter, more frequent bends.
You can use UseConstantBeltWidthRatio (on by default) instead of this for simpler but less fine tuned meander wavelengths.

properties.name: WavelengthMultiplierAtAnchor
properties.description:
Wavelength multiplier at the anchor point for braided streams.
Streams longer than anchor length continue growing the meander wavelength linearly.
The meander wavelength (meander length down the stream) at each point is the streambed width at that point multiplied by this value.
Higher wavelength multiplier means longer, more gradual meanders.
Lower wavelength multiplier means tighter, more frequent bends.
You can use UseConstantBeltWidthRatio (on by default) instead of this for simpler but less fine tuned meander wavelengths.

properties.name: WavelengthScalingPower
properties.description: Power curve applied to the wavelength scaling from source to anchor for braided streams.

properties.name: UseConstantBeltWidthRatio
properties.description:
When true, automatically calculates wavelength multipliers to maintain a constant meander belt width to stream width ratio along all positions in the braided river.
The ratio is set by BeltWidthToStreamWidthRatio.
When false, the meandering uses the manually set WavelengthMultiplierAtSource and WavelengthMultiplierAtAnchor values instead.

properties.name: BeltWidthToStreamWidthRatio
properties.description:
Target ratio of meander belt width to stream bed width for braided streams. Only used when UseConstantBeltWidthRatio is true.
0.35 means the meander belt width is 35% of stream width. Higher that than means you get wider meander belts relative to the stream width.
The wavelength multipliers are automatically calculated from this ratio and the sinuosity values.

properties.name: CurvatureDisplacementMultipiler
properties.description: Higher means stronger growth of the existing bends for braided streams.

properties.name: MeanderFading
properties.description: Configuration for fading out meandering into a smooth path at the braided stream source and mouth.

nestedProperties.name: SourceDistanceAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Distance from the braided stream source (in blocks) when the stream is at the anchor's stream length, over which to fade meandering back to the original path.
This distance scales with stream length: short streams have proportionally shorter fade distances, long streams have proportionally longer fade distances.
Basically, its how big the fadeout of meandering is near the stream source.

nestedProperties.name: SourceExponent
nestedProperties.description:
Power curve exponent for source fade transition on braided streams.
This controls how quickly the meandering fades into the straight path near the stream source.

nestedProperties.name: MouthDistanceAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Distance from the braided stream drain/connection (in blocks) when the stream is at the anchor's stream length, over which to fade meandering back to a straight connection.
This distance scales with stream length: short streams have proportionally shorter fade distances, long streams have proportionally longer fade distances.
Basically, its how big the fadeout of meandering is near the stream mouth.

nestedProperties.name: MouthExponent
nestedProperties.description:
Power curve exponent for mouth fade transition on braided streams.
This controls how quickly the meandering fades into the straight connection to the drain/main stream.

properties.name: CurvePointSmoothing
properties.description: Configuration for smoothing out the braided stream path (the curve points) inbetween the iterations of meandering.

nestedProperties.name: WindowRadius
nestedProperties.description:
Number of neighboring points on each side to include in smoothing window for braided streams.
Controls spatial extent of smoothing effect. Applied per iteration.
1 gives a 3-point window (current + 2 neighbors), 2 gives a 5-point window, 3 gives a 7-point window.

nestedProperties.name: Strength
nestedProperties.description:
Controls the intensity of the smoothing within the smoothing window for braided streams.
0.0 to 1.0 is no smoothing to full smoothing, and 1.0+ is even more smoothing.
Adjust together with WindowRadius.

properties.name: SteepTerrainStraightening
properties.description: Configuration for straightening braided streams around steep terrain.

nestedProperties.name: BlendStrength
nestedProperties.description:
Maximum strength of blending the meandered path back to original bezier curve path in and around steep terrain for braided streams.
0 means no blending (full meandering everywhere). 1 means a hard switch to the bezier curve when the path gets to an area with the max steepness.

nestedProperties.name: HeightThreshold
nestedProperties.description: Height difference (in blocks) at which steep terrain blending reaches full strength for braided streams.

nestedProperties.name: BlendPower
nestedProperties.description: Power curve exponent for steep terrain blending on braided streams.

nestedProperties.name: SearchRadius
nestedProperties.description:
Manhattan distance radius (in chunks) for searching neighboring terrain when calculating max height difference for braided streams.
0 means only use the current chunk. 1 means include immediate neighbors. 2+ means a larger search area.

properties.name: OxbowCutoff
properties.description: Configuration for cutting off a braided stream as it intersects with itself via meandering, creating an oxbow lake.

nestedProperties.name: ProximityThreshold
nestedProperties.description: Minimum distance between meander curves as fraction of the local meander's amplitude for braided streams.

nestedProperties.name: MinWavelengthArcLengthFraction
nestedProperties.description:
Minimum arc length gap between segments of the braided stream path, as a fraction of the local wavelength.
Only segment pairs separated by at least this fraction of the wavelength are checked for oxbow cutoffs.

nestedProperties.name: MaxCutAttempts
nestedProperties.description: Maximum attempts to cut oxbows per iteration for braided streams.

configs.description: Settings for the shapes and sizes of the streams.

properties.name: StreamBedWidthAtAnchor
properties.description:
Width in blocks of the deepest part of the main stream at the position of the anchor.
Must be less than StreamBankWidthAtAnchor.

properties.name: StreamBankWidthAtAnchor
properties.description:
Total width in blocks of the main stream banks at position of the anchor.
Must be less than ValleyWidthAtAnchor and greater than BedWidthAtAnchor.

properties.name: StreamValleyWidthAtAnchor
properties.description:
Total width in blocks of the terrain guided towards a valley shape for main streams at the scaling anchor length.
Must be greater than BankWidthAtAnchor.
The valley used to be way more important than it is now, currently its almost ignored.

properties.name: MinimumBedWidth
properties.description:
Minimum width in blocks of the main stream bed at its source (narrowest point).
Streams taper from StreamBedWidth at the mouth to this value at the source.

properties.name: MinimumBankWidth
properties.description:
Minimum width in blocks of the main stream banks at the source (narrowest point).
Banks taper from StreamBankWidth at the mouth to this value at the source.

properties.name: BedLowestDepth
properties.description:
Depth in blocks of the stream bed from the surrounding terrain level. Controls the maximum depth of the deepest part of streams (before the bend pooling).
Should be greater than BankLowestDepth for natural appearance.
If you make this too deep it will make the streams like ravines, cutting into the terrain.
If you make this too shallow you'll see a lot more broken streams on mountains/hills, with water spilling off the sides.
One day I might figure out a better solution to the spilling water, so you can make this shallow without worries.

properties.name: BankLowestDepth
properties.description:
Depth in blocks of stream banks relative to surrounding terrain.
Creates a transition zone between stream bed and valley.
Should be between BedLowestDepth and ValleyLowestDepth.

properties.name: ValleyLowestDepth
properties.description:
Depth of the stream valley edges relative to surrounding terrain.
Controls how gradually streams blend into surrounding terrain.
Should be less than BankLowestDepth for natural appearance. Will need to be adjusted depending on world height.
Can also be negative, lifting up the area around streams to make the stream banks more defined.

properties.name: Tributary
properties.description: Configuration for tributary stream dimensions including width, bank, and valley settings.

nestedProperties.name: BedWidthAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Width in blocks of the deepest part of tributary streams at the scaling anchor length.
Must be less than BankWidthAtAnchor.

nestedProperties.name: BankWidthAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Total width in blocks of tributary stream banks at the scaling anchor length.
Must be less than ValleyWidthAtAnchor and greater than BedWidthAtAnchor.

nestedProperties.name: ValleyWidthAtAnchor
nestedProperties.description:
Total width in blocks of the terrain guided towards a valley shape for tributary streams at the scaling anchor length.
Must be greater than BankWidthAtAnchor.

nestedProperties.name: MinimumBedWidth
nestedProperties.description:
Minimum width in blocks of the tributary bed at its source.
Tributaries taper from BedWidthAtAnchor at the connection to this value at the source.

nestedProperties.name: MinimumBankWidth
nestedProperties.description:
Minimum width in blocks of the tributary banks at the source.
Banks taper from BankWidthAtAnchor at the connection to this value at the source.

nestedProperties.name: BedAlphaMultiplier
nestedProperties.description:
Opacity multiplier for tributary bed layer.
Reduces the depth of tributaries compared to main streams.

configs.description: Settings for where water is placed and how entitys are pushed downstream by the stream water.

properties.name: WaterBelowStreamBed
properties.description:
The distance in blocks below the center of the stream bed, that air blocks turns to water.
This fills in water when there are indents around the center of the stream. For example if one side of the river is deeper than the center.
If the center of the river is on a bump and to the side the bed is deeper, this needs to be large enough to make up the difference.

properties.name: WaterAboveStreamBedMaximum
properties.description:
Maximum water height above the stream bed.
Its still capped by the heights of the stream banks, so you can't make it go super high.
You can lower this to make the river water shallower, or higher if you make the rivers larger and deeper to make the water still reach the banks.

properties.name: PercentOfStreamBedAsCoreArea
properties.description:
Threshold for determining the core streambed area (a stream bed opacity above this is considered core).
Used to placing water blocks 1 high on the streambed center/core area even when there isn't enough bank height,
ensuring the water stream is continuous, even if the banks are busted up.
If you make this too low there will be water on the banks of streams.
If you make this too high streams with broken banks will also have a broken stream.

properties.name: StreamBedWaterPlacementThreshold
properties.description:
Minimum stream bed opacity value required for water block placement.
With lower resolution stream maps where blockColumnsPerPixel is over 1, the bilerp blur
causes bed opacity to blur onto bank areas. This threshold filters out those blurred values.
This threshold should be >= StreamBedBlockPlacementThreshold.

properties.name: StreamBedBlockPlacementThreshold
properties.description:
Minimum bedAlpha value required for streambed block placement (gravel, sand, clay, etc).
Set this lower than StreamBedWaterPlacementThreshold to place streambed blocks on
old/weak streambeds (like braided stream channels) without flooding them with water.
This allows dry gravel bars and exposed streambed areas in braided stream systems.

properties.name: WaterForwardOffset
properties.description:
Forward offset for water placement along the stream curve.
Pushes water placement forward by this many curve points to help create the impression that the water is flowing downstream.
Higher values make water bulge out foward more, lower values keep it closer to the streambed.

properties.name: UpstreamBankHeightSampling
properties.description:
Configuration for sampling the upstream bank heights.
These sampled heights constrain the water height from exceeding the banks.
The water placement samples upstream from each position to help prevent water from being higher than water upstream.
Uses the median of multiple upstream bank heights to prevent sudden water level changes from terrain bumps on individual bank points.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description:
Enable upstream bank height sampling for smoother water levels.
When enabled, water height is constrained by the median of multiple upstream bank heights, instead of just the immediate left/right bank points.
This prevents sudden water level jumps when a single bank point has a terrain bump.

nestedProperties.name: SampleIntervalBlocks
nestedProperties.description:
Distance in blocks between each upstream bank height sample.
Smaller values mean more samples but since sampling is expensive for performance, it could slow down generation if set too low.

nestedProperties.name: TotalDistanceBlocks
nestedProperties.description:
When deciding water height for a position on the stream based on the banks, this is the total distance in blocks to sample upstream from that position.
The number of samples is the TotalDistanceBlocks divided by the SampleIntervalBlocks.

properties.name: StreamWaterPush
properties.description: Configuration for stream water push mechanics that push entities (like players and animals) downstream.

nestedProperties.name: PushMagnitude
nestedProperties.description:
The base magnitude of the push vector applied to entities in stream water.
This is scaled by the stream's width factor (wider streams push harder).

nestedProperties.name: DownstreamSampleDistance
nestedProperties.description:
Number of curve points away downstream to use as the vector target sample when calculating flow direction.
The push vector aims from the upstream sample towards the downstream sample.
This direction causes entities to drift more towards the outer bank of bends instead of towards the center of the stream (when this is at 0).

nestedProperties.name: UpstreamSampleDistance
nestedProperties.description:
Number of curve points away upstream to use as the vector origin sample for push direction calculation.
The push vector aims from the upstream sample towards the downstream sample.
This direction causes entities to drift more towards the outer bank of bends instead of towards the center of the stream (when this is at 0).

nestedProperties.name: BankSpeedFactor
nestedProperties.description: How fast the push is near the stream banks compared to the center (0.0 to 1.0). Should be lower than PushMagnitude, the shallow water on the banks shouldn't push you downstream as much as the center of a flowing stream.

properties.name: CoastalTerrain
properties.description: Configuration for terrain modification effects that create coastal lowlands and inland highlands.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description:
When enabled, creates a gradual terrain height transition from low coastal areas to higher inland areas.
This makes terrain near oceans lower, creating realistic coastal lowlands. Then it makes inland terrain higher, creating highlands and a subtle, realistic slope from coast to inland.

nestedProperties.name: BlurRadius
nestedProperties.description:
Blur radius for the coastal map.
A higher BlurRadius extends the effect further inland, creating smoother coastal-to-inland transitions.
The basegame ocean map blur radius is 5.

nestedProperties.name: InlandMaxRaising
nestedProperties.description:
Maximum height lift in blocks for inland terrain, outside of the coastal map's influence (far inland).
The lift fades to zero near and past coasts where the coastal map has full influence.

nestedProperties.name: CoastalMaxLowering
nestedProperties.description:
Maximum height lowering in blocks for coastal terrain near the ocean.
Combined with InlandMaxRaising, this creates coastal lowland/beach/marshy areas and higher inland areas.

nestedProperties.name: CoastlinePercentile
nestedProperties.description:
The opacity percentile (0-1) where coastal terrain lowering starts lowering.
Above this percentile is full terrain lowering, below this and the terrain lowering fades to zero.
Set this higher than InlandLiftPercentile to create a beach/lowland zone with lowering but no lift.

nestedProperties.name: InlandLiftPercentile
nestedProperties.description:
The opacity percentile (0-1) where inland terrain lift begins.
Above this percentile is no lift, below this the lift fades in towards it's full effect inland.
Set lower than CoastlinePercentile to create a beach/lowland zone between lowering and lifting.

nestedProperties.name: SandThreshold
nestedProperties.description:
The opacity percentile (0-1) above which underwater areas get sand instead of muddy gravel.
This affects areas lowered below sea level by the coastal effect.

properties.name: Groundwater
properties.description: Configuration for the groundwater system that creates seeping walls and water spawning when digging in areas with high water flow.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description:
Enables or disables the groundwater.
When disabled, breaking blocks in groundwater zones will not trigger water spawning and dripping walls.
Groundwater data is still generated in chunks, so you can enable this later and it will work with existing chunks.

nestedProperties.name: MaxDepth
nestedProperties.description:
Maximum depth of groundwater below the surface (excluding the first 3 blocks which never contain groundwater).
This is the maximum additional depth when flow is at or above the threshold.

nestedProperties.name: FlowThreshold
nestedProperties.description:
Flow value at which groundwater reaches maximum depth.
Areas with flow at or above this value will have full groundwater depth.
Lower flow values result in proportionally shallower groundwater zones.
If you change the number of waterflow iterations you'll need to adjust this accordingly

nestedProperties.name: ConnectivityRadius
nestedProperties.description:
Horizontal radius with taxicab distance to search for connected porous blocks when validating walls for groundwater.
Only blocks at the same Y level are considered.

nestedProperties.name: ConnectivityThreshold
nestedProperties.description:
Minimum number of connected porous blocks (soil, gravel, or porous stone) required for a wall to be valid for groundwater seepage.
Walls with fewer connected blocks will not drip or spawn water.

nestedProperties.name: DripTimeSeconds
nestedProperties.description:
Time in seconds that the walls around a broken block within groundwater spends seeping water.
After this time, a full water block spawns and the seeping stops.

nestedProperties.name: SeepIntervalSeconds
nestedProperties.description:
Time in seconds between each finite water spawn at the broken position.
After the initial drip time completes, water will continue to spawn at this interval.

properties.name: StreamFishSpawn
properties.description: Configuration for spawning extra fish in streams.

nestedProperties.name: ChunkGenBaseSpawnChance
nestedProperties.description: Base fish spawn chance per stream water block during world generation.

nestedProperties.name: ChunkGenNarrowStreamBonus
nestedProperties.description:
Additional spawn chance bonus for narrow streams during world generation.
Narrow streams get the full bonus, wide streams get none.

nestedProperties.name: RuntimeSpawnMultiplier
nestedProperties.description:
Multiplier for runtime fish spawning in streams compared to normal water.
1.0 means stream water spawns fish at the same rate as normal water.

nestedProperties.name: Enabled
nestedProperties.description: Toggle for the spawning extra fish in streams.

configs.description: Settings for blocks in the stream bed and aquatic plants on the stream bed.

properties.name: BaseVolume
properties.description:
Base volume for stream sounds at the stream source.
0.0 is no sound, 1.0 is full volume.

properties.name: MaxVolume
properties.description:
Maximum volume that stream sounds can reach.
0.0 is no sound, 1.0 is full volume.

properties.name: VolumeScaleWithWidth
properties.description:
Additional volume added at the anchor length.
The volume scales along the streams from BaseVolume to VolumeScaleWithWidth.

properties.name: AmbientBlockCount
properties.description:
Number of stream blocks needed to reach the full sound volume.
Lower AmbientBlockCount makes streams louder with fewer blocks

properties.name: EnableCustomStreamSound
properties.description: Whether to use the custom stream sound file instead of the vanilla creek sound

properties.name: LowPassFilterBase
properties.description:
Base low-pass filter amount for narrow stream sounds.
Lower LowPassFilterBase reduces high frequencies at the source.

properties.name: LowPassFilterWidthScale
properties.description:
How much to reduce high frequencies as stream width increases.
Wider streams have more bass.

properties.name: LowPassFilterMinimum
properties.description: Minimum low-pass filter value for the widest streams.

properties.name: EnableFrequencyFiltering
properties.description: Whether to enable dynamic frequency filtering based on distance from the stream and the local stream width

presets.name: OceansWith256WorldHeightMidrangeCPU
presets.displayName: Oceans With 256 World Height on a Midrange CPU

presets.name: OceansWith512WorldHeightGoodCPUOrServer
presets.displayName: Oceans With 512 World Height on a Good CPU or Server

presets.name: OceansWith512WorldHeightMidrangeCPU
presets.displayName: Oceans With 512 World Height on a Midrange CPU
